channel.title: CVE Feed for Siemens -- InterMesh 7177 Hybrid 2.0 Subscriber
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Siemens -- InterMesh 7177 Hybrid 2.0 Subscriber

item.title: CVE-2024-47901|2024-10-23T18:18:54.551Z -- siemens -- intermesh%207177%20hybrid%202.0%20subscriber
item.description: A vulnerability has been identified in InterMesh 7177 Hybrid 2.0 Subscriber (All versions < V8.2.12), InterMesh 7707 Fire Subscriber (All versions < V7.2.12 only if the IP interface is enabled (which is not the default configuration)). The web server of affected devices does not sanitize the input parameters in specific GET requests that allow for code execution on operating system level. In combination with other vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-47902, CVE-2024-47903, CVE-2024-47904) this could allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to execute arbitrary code with root privileges.

item.title: CVE-2024-47904|2024-10-23T18:00:15.305Z -- siemens -- intermesh%207177%20hybrid%202.0%20subscriber
item.description: A vulnerability has been identified in InterMesh 7177 Hybrid 2.0 Subscriber (All versions < V8.2.12), InterMesh 7707 Fire Subscriber (All versions < V7.2.12 only if the IP interface is enabled (which is not the default configuration)). The affected devices contain a SUID binary that could allow an authenticated local attacker to execute arbitrary commands with root privileges.

item.title: CVE-2024-47903|2024-10-23T18:02:13.310Z -- siemens -- intermesh%207177%20hybrid%202.0%20subscriber
item.description: A vulnerability has been identified in InterMesh 7177 Hybrid 2.0 Subscriber (All versions < V8.2.12), InterMesh 7707 Fire Subscriber (All versions < V7.2.12 only if the IP interface is enabled (which is not the default configuration)). The web server of affected devices allows to write arbitrary files to the web server's DocumentRoot directory.

item.title: CVE-2024-47902|2024-10-23T18:16:39.383Z -- siemens -- intermesh%207177%20hybrid%202.0%20subscriber
item.description: A vulnerability has been identified in InterMesh 7177 Hybrid 2.0 Subscriber (All versions < V8.2.12), InterMesh 7707 Fire Subscriber (All versions < V7.2.12 only if the IP interface is enabled (which is not the default configuration)). The web server of affected devices does not authenticate GET requests that execute specific commands (such as `ping`) on operating system level.

The web server of affected devices does not authenticate GET requests that execute specific commands (such as `ping`) on operating system level.

The web server of affected devices allows to write arbitrary files to the web server's DocumentRoot directory.

The affected devices contain a SUID binary that could allow an authenticated local attacker to execute arbitrary commands with root privileges.

item.title: CVE-2024-47901|2024-10-23T14:21:19.200Z -- siemens -- intermesh%207177%20hybrid%202.0%20subscriber
item.description: A vulnerability has been identified in InterMesh 7177 Hybrid 2.0 Subscriber (All versions < V8.2.12), InterMesh 7707 Fire Subscriber (All versions < V7.2.12 only if the IP interface is enabled (which is not the default configuration)). The web server of affected devices does not sanitize the input parameters in specific GET requests that allow for code execution on operating system level. In combination with other vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-47902, CVE-2024-47903, CVE-2024-47904) this could allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to execute arbitrary code with root privileges.
